content.title: Border Areas Development Department
content.beneficiary: People living in remote and inaccessible areas near the International Boundary
content.details: The main objective of the BADP is to meet the special developmental needs and well-being of the people living in remote and inaccessible areas situated near the International Boundary (IB) and to provide the border areas with essential infrastructure by convergence of BADS/other Central/State/UT/Local Schemes and through a participatory approach especially in six thematic areas - Basic Infrastructure, Health Infrastructure, Education, Agriculture & Water Resources, Financial Inclusion and Skill Development.
benefits: Construction of retaining walls to protect the roads in hilly areas
Construction of houses for Government doctors and paramedics
Setting up of Government mobile dispensaries/ambulances
Purchase of medical equipment in Government Hospitals
Construction of Primary/Middle/Secondary/Higher secondary school buildings
Construction of hostels/dormitories in Secondary/Higher Secondary school
Construction of play fields and mini stadiums
Drinking Water Supply projects in Government schools
Construction of anganwadi centers and community centers
Construction of infrastructure for Small Scale Industries
eligibility: Covers 396 Blocks of 111 border Districts in 16 States and 2 Union Territories abutting the International Boundary
Includes all census villages/towns within 0-10 Km distance from the International Boundary
Strategic villages/towns identified by Border Guarding Forces will be prioritized

faqs.question: Is the scheme covering all the border districts of mentioned states?
What is BADP OMS?
faqs.answer: System used for mapping of the villages/towns through the BADP Online Management System.

faqs.question: Who will review the implementation details of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Empowered Committee will review the implementation of all the individual/family/community benefit schemes of Government of India in the border areas.

faqs.question: What will be the major benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Road development, Drinking water supply, Health infrastructures and so on.

faqs.question: What are strategic villages/towns?
faqs.answer: Census villages, semi-urban and urban areas identified by BGFs as 'strategic villages/towns' within the 0-10 km area.
